Message.Title: Death paanels?
Message.Msg: AP BROWNSVILLE, Texas (AP) â€” Jose Gallegos' company eliminated employee health insurance to save money, so when his gut started hurting and his skin took on a yellow tinge, he resisted seeing a doctor. When he finally went to the emergency room, physicians diagnosed stomach cancer. Gallegos made too much money to qualify for Medicaid but not enough to buy his own insurance, so he scraped together what he could, and his wife, Andrea, took on three jobs. Just over a year later, at 41, he died, leaving behind four children. Two years later, it was Andrea's turn. A crack and sharp pain in her back drove her to the emergency room, where she learned she had breast cancer. It had snapped one of her vertebra. Now 45, she said the cancer remains in several other vertebrae, but at the moment it's not spreading. Families like the Gallegos stand at the center of a debate over President Barack Obama's health care overhaul, which could have expanded Medicaid coverage to 1.3 million uninsured Texans. But Republican Gov. Rick Perry has said he will not widen the program because it would cost too much.

Message.Title: Earnings Show Recession May Be 'Fast Approaching'
Message.Msg: While this quarter's earnings reports have crossed a substantially lowered profit bar, future expectations through the year indicate a recession could be on the way. Estimates for the third and fourth quarters have been dropped to levels not seen since the days of the 2008 financial crisis, below even the muted 2 percent expected level of inflation. That's an ominous recession sign for an economy that has barely managed to attain positive growth this year even with the strong level of earnings beats, according to an analysis by Nicholas Colas, chief market strategist at ConvergEx in New York.

Topic.Title: LOGIC TELLS YOU OBAMA WILL LOSE BIG---WHY?

Message.Msg: You may be right-but. There are about 3 million federal employees. Paul Ryan and the GOP have featured a budget plan that calls for 3 yr freeze on raises for government employees. there has also bee a 2 yr freeze already.- that means the GOP ( Romney has endorsed the freeze) wants to freeze federal salaries for a total of 5 yrs. Additionally they want a bigger contribution (5%) more from employees for retirement. Basically means that in 3 yrs a federal employee will be taking home 5% less than 2 yrs ago. add about 2% a yr for inflation that's 15% less in buying power lost over 5 yrs ( not including increases for health coverage) Obama, on the other hand has promised a veto of any budget that does not include a .5% increase in pay for federal workers. There are a lot of feds and their spouses living in VA. that's a "swing state" same thing in FL Rick Scott has devastated the state retirement program. Obama strong here too. I'm sick and tired of watching Steve Forbes on FOX news telling me I'm feeding at the federal trough just opinion
